content:
I am a Junior Undergraduate at Indian Institute of Technology, Kanpur majoring in Computer Science and Engineering, broadly interested in the areas of Probabilistic Machine Learning, Sequential Decision Making and Online Learning.
I have been working with Prof.Soumendu Sundar Mukherjee since December 2019 at Indian Statistical Institute, Kolkata. Currently, we are working on the problem of online learning and sequential decision making in multi-agent systems. We formerly worked on Change Point Detection in Topic Proportions of Temporal Text Data. I have also been working with Prof.Piyush Rai at IIT Kanpur since August 2020, on the problem of learning interpolations in images using Neural ODEs. In my sophomore year, I worked with Prof. Ketan Rajawat at IIT Kanpur on Online Bayesian Inference for multi-way temporal Tensors.
For recreation purposes, I play guitar and am an avid follower of Formula1.

content: Developed a framework to train deep generative models using interpolations modelled by Neural ODEs which simultaneously learns a distribution of trajectories which interpolate smoothly and reversibly between pairs of images ensuring these interpolations have high image quality and are diverse in nature.
summary: Developed a framework to train deep generative models using interpolations modelled by Neural ODEs which simultaneously learns a distribution of trajectories which interpolate smoothly and reversibly between pairs of images ensuring these interpolations have high image quality and are diverse in nature.
title: NeurInt : Learning to Interpolate using Neural ODEs

content: Developed a specialized temporal topic model with provisions for change points, scalable to large corpora of text data. Our model facilitates detection change points, ie.changes in the distribution generating data when the data is textual in nature. We were able to detect accurately well known changepoints in real datasets, like literary eras in English Literature and Trends in High Energy Physics research papers.

content: Explored Approximate Inference for high volume and multi-way temporal data in Tensor form for Traffic Prediction. I extended pre-existing Tensor Factorization models, to a model obeying first-order auto-regression to capture the temporal dynamics useful for online applications like traffic forecasting and predicting estimated time of arrival for cab services.
